Title: if $ab=cd$ then $a+b+c+d $ is composite
Content:
Let $a,b,c,d$ be natural numbers with $ab=cd$ .
Prove that $a+b+c+d$ is composite. I have my own solution for this ( posted below ). I want to see if there is any other good proofs.
AcceptedAnswer:
By the Four Number Theorem (a consequence of unique prime factorization), it follows that $ab=cd$ implies $a=xy, b=zt, c=xz, d=yt$ for some integers $x,y,z,t$ . Hence $$
a+b+c+d=(x+t)(y+z).
$$
